org.jamesframework.ext.permutation

Class PermutationProblem<DataType extends org.jamesframework.core.problems.datatypes.IntegerIdentifiedData>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamesframework.core.problems.GenericProblem<PermutationSolution,DataType>
      • org.jamesframework.ext.permutation.PermutationProblem<DataType>
  • Type Parameters:
    DataType - data type of the permutation problem, required to implement the IntegerIdentifiedData interface
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.jamesframework.core.problems.Problem<PermutationSolution>

    public class PermutationProblem<DataType extends org.jamesframework.core.problems.datatypes.IntegerIdentifiedData>
extends org.jamesframework.core.problems.GenericProblem<PermutationSolution,DataType>
    Generic permutation problem. Requires that every item in the data set is identified with a unique integer ID. The solution type is fixed to PermutationSolution, which models a solution as an ordered sequence of these IDs. The data type can be any class or interface that implements the IntegerIdentifiedData interface, which imposes the assignment of IDs to items in the data set. A default random solution generator is used, which creates random permutations by shuffling the list of IDs as retrieved from the data.
    Author:
    Herman De Beukelaer
